titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1229, PUTTING THE GULF OF MEXICO BACK TO WORK ACT, AND PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1230, RESTARTING AMERICAN OFFSHORE LEASING NOW ACT

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1229, PUTTING THE GULF OF MEXICO BACK TO WORK ACT, AND PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1230, RESTARTING AMERICAN OFFSHORE LEASING NOW ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 157, No. 60

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Restarting American Offshore Leasing Now Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 1230, to require the Secretary of the Interior to conduct certain offshore oil and gas lease sales, by a recorded vote of 266 ayes to 149 noes, Roll No. 298.<P/>Rejected the LujaAE1n motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Natural Resources with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a recorded vote of 171 ayes to 238 noes, Roll No. 297.<P/>Holt amendment (No. 1 printed in part B of H. Rept. 1120973) that sought to remove provisions in the bill that would ``deem'' the safety and environmental review done in 2007, prior to the BP spill, sufficient for new offshore oil and gas leasing. The amendment would allow lease sales to go forward, but require new environmental and safety reviews, following the BP spill (by a recorded vote of 174 ayes to 240 noes, Roll No. 295) and<P/>Connolly amendment (No. 2 printed in part B of H. Rept. 1120973) that sought to ensure that Lease Sale 220 does not interfere with Naval or other DOD operations (by a recorded vote of 176 ayes to 240 noes, Roll No. 296).<P/>H. Res. 245, the rule providing for consideration of the bills (H.R. 1229) and (H.R. 1230) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 245 ayes to 167 noes, Roll No. 294, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 241 yeas to 171 nays, Roll No. 293.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Restarting American Offshore Leasing Now Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 1230, to require the Secretary of the Interior to conduct certain offshore oil and gas lease sales, by a recorded vote of 266 ayes to 149 noes, Roll No. 298.<P/>Rejected the LujaAE1n motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Natural Resources with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a recorded vote of 171 ayes to 238 noes, Roll No. 297.<P/>Holt amendment (No. 1 printed in part B of H. Rept. 1120973) that sought to remove provisions in the bill that would ``deem'' the safety and environmental review done in 2007, prior to the BP spill, sufficient for new offshore oil and gas leasing. The amendment would allow lease sales to go forward, but require new environmental and safety reviews, following the BP spill (by a recorded vote of 174 ayes to 240 noes, Roll No. 295) and<P/>Connolly amendment (No. 2 printed in part B of H. Rept. 1120973) that sought to ensure that Lease Sale 220 does not interfere with Naval or other DOD operations (by a recorded vote of 176 ayes to 240 noes, Roll No. 296).<P/>H. Res. 245, the rule providing for consideration of the bills (H.R. 1229) and (H.R. 1230) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 245 ayes to 167 noes, Roll No. 294, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 241 yeas to 171 nays, Roll No. 293.

titleInfo.title: RESTARTING AMERICAN OFFSHORE LEASING NOW ACT

extension.searchTitle: RESTARTING AMERICAN OFFSHORE LEASING NOW ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 157, No. 60

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Restarting American Offshore Leasing Now Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 1230, to require the Secretary of the Interior to conduct certain offshore oil and gas lease sales, by a recorded vote of 266 ayes to 149 noes, Roll No. 298.
